channel.title: Jakub Langr's Blog - Jakub Langr
channel.description: About data and all things awesome

item.title: GANs & applied ML @ ICLR 2019
item.description: Understanding the bleeding-edge GAN papers from one of the world's best known AI research conferences. Some musings on the academic workshops on "applied ML".
item.dc:creator: Jakub Langr

item.title: AI Gets Creative Thanks To GANs Innovations
item.description: Review of some areas where GANs have been applied for all those people that keep asking me where do they get applied, haha.
item.dc:creator: Jakub Langr

item.title: List of ICML GAN Papers
item.description: All ICML GANs / Generative Papers: I went to Stockholm and spoke to academics, so you don't have to! Domain adaptation, 3D GANs, Data Inputation using GANs and much more!
item.dc:creator: Jakub Langr

item.title: Prioritised list of AI threats
item.description: My contribution to what I feel like is fundamentally lacking from the "dangers of AI" debate.
item.dc:creator: Jakub Langr

item.title: Coding for GANS & (Semi)-Learning
item.description: As it often happens, I get busy at work and forget to publish something I should have really done months ago. Well, this code is that thing. But at least it's now nice and shiny.
item.dc:creator: Jakub Langr

item.title: GANs & Semi-Supervised Learning
item.description: I know what you're thinking: can there be anything more exciting? Rest assured, the wild party don't stop there. So hold on to your glasses nerds, we're going to do some A-friggin-I. Or if you're into ML and think this minus the sarcasm. But actually, this is super cool.
item.dc:creator: Jakub Langr

item.title: Artificially Intelligent Business
item.description: AI is moving forward at an amazing rate but we should take the time to appreciate all the amazing potential of the recent advancements. I want to take the time to get some technical appreciation for the business implications the recent AI may have.
item.dc:creator: Jakub Langr

item.title: Kaggle Struggle
item.description: My trip to the <1% of data scientists. Or in the the world of competitive data science and back again. Aka: three (relative) successes and a fail. Also how not to spend a lot of money on your data problem. I need to start writing better summaries.
item.dc:creator: Jakub Langr

item.title: ...especially about the future
item.description: A year ago, I wrote about the Good Judgment Project -- an attempt to use prediction markets to study our understanding of forecasting of geo-political events. I was lucky to be selected as one of the participants in this project and now I am eager to share my thoughts.
item.dc:creator: Jakub Langr

item.title: Speaking at European Economic Congress 2015
item.description: I wanted to write a personal post about my experience speaking at an international conference and what I think the trouble with policy-makers trying to spur entrepreneurship is.
item.dc:creator: Jakub Langr

item.title: On MOOCs: Projects, Practice and Perspective
item.description: I said I will stop at finishing 14 online courses... and I am doing three MOOCs again. Review of my learning journey, projects I have done, reviews of great and good courses, my (brief) take on practices. UPDATED.
item.dc:creator: Jakub Langr

item.title: On Randomness in (Social) Science
item.description: Slightly technical, but relatively simple introduction to randomness and why it has to be everywhere around us. (Also check out the cool new LaTeX plug-in.)
item.dc:creator: Jakub Langr

item.title: Web Summit Dublin 2014
item.description: An amazing week filled with learning about tech and startups, in the presence of inspiring people, cool businesses and most importantly fellow scholars--probably the most awesome group of people in existence.
item.dc:creator: Jakub Langr

item.title: #hackZurich 2014: A hackhathon to remember
item.description: My experiences at #hachZurich (http://hackzurich.com/): 30+ hours of coding, 5 hours of sleep, 14 hours of transportation door-to-door and back. One epic weekend.
item.dc:creator: Jakub Langr

item.title: Tracking the CrISIS in Syria
item.description: Exploring the power of Big Data approach (GDELT) applied to the civil war in Syria to get unconventional insights into the Syrian civil war and the terror tactics of ISIS.
item.dc:creator: Jakub Langr

item.title: Predictions R hard
item.description: Quick and dirty statistical modeling in R for social scientists, decision makers and enthusiasts. Insights from my involvement in a US intelligence project.
item.dc:creator: Jakub Langr
